name: InventoryNotification
description:
This endpoint is used by *sellers* to notify marketplaces that the inventory level has changed for one of their SKUs. 

There is no request body in this call, indicating the new inventory level, for instance. It only notifies a specific marketplace (`accountName`) that a seller (`sellerId`) has changed the inventory level of an SKU (`skuId`). 

*Marketplaces* will then call the [fulfillment endpoint](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/fulfillment-simulation) provided in the seller registration form to get the updated inventory  information.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account that belongs to the marketplace. The notification will be posted into this account.

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

Accept.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

Content-Type.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

sellerId.description: A string that identifies the seller in the marketplace. This ID must be created by the marketplace and informed to the seller before the integration is built.

skuId.description: A string that identifies the SKU in the seller, that suffered the change. This is the ID that the marketplace will use for all  references to this SKU, such as price and inventory notifications.
